item.title: Smashing Your SANS Course
item.description: Introduction If you’re reading this post, you likely know of the SANS course and associated GIAC certification. You’re likely about to sit your course and/or exam and are looking for some tips and tricks to maximise the amount of value you get out of this eye-wateringly expensive course. This post is an overview of the tips and tricks that I have for smashing your SANS GIAC experience. At time of writing, I’ve been lucky enough to undertake FOR508: Advanced Incident Response, Threat Hunting, and Digital Forensics and SEC511: Continuous Monitoring and Security Operations and successfully pass both associated exams to become GCFA and GMON certified.

item.title: SOARing by the seat of your pants
item.description: There’s a lot of hype with Security Orchestration, Automation and Response (SOAR) and on paper it basically sells itself. A product that improves Time To Respond (TTR) metrics whilst decreasing FTE count is a CISO’s wet dream. But unfortunately, many orgs find it difficult to realise value with their SOAR products and in a way are soaring by the seat of their pants. This blog post provides some (no marketting) recommendations on how you can realise the most value from your SOAR investment.

item.title: thought-provoking career thoughts
item.description: An assortment of career-related posts that I found to be thought-provoking (but I should note that I do not necessarily agree with all of these). You are not an employee, you are a business. It’s not personal; it’s business. How to waste your career, one comfortable year at a time Apoorva (apoorvagovind) provides a framework for evaluating when we are being complacent and the realisation of the true cost of this.
